<div id="lg_g"><div class="log_oo"> <img alt="azadi ka amrit mahotsav" src="https://static.pib.gov.in/WriteReadData/specificdocs/photo/2021/aug/ph202183101.png"/> </div></div>
<div class="text-center event-heading-background">
<h2 id="Titleh2">
                        SRI LANKA IS A KEY PARTNER IN INDIA’S ‘NEIGHBOURHOOD FIRST’ POLICY AND ‘VISION SAGAR’: LOK SABHA SPEAKER SHRI OM BIRLA
                    </h2>
<h3 id="Subtitleh3">
<span id="ltrSubtitle"><br/>BOTH INDIA AND SRI LANKA WELCOME THE FORMATION OF SRI LANKA-INDIA PARLIAMENTARY FRIENDSHIP ASSOCIATION AS A POSITIVE INITIATIVE<br/><br/>SRI LANKA APPRECIATES INDIA’S ROLE IN ENSURING PEACE AND STABILITY IN THE INDIAN OCEAN REGION AND EXPRESSES GRATITUDE FOR INDIA’S ASSISTANCE DURING ITS ECONOMIC CRISIS<br/><br/>LOK SABHA SPEAKER HIGHLIGHTS ADOPTION OF DIGITAL INNOVATIONS AND USE OF AI TECHNOLOGY IN PARLIAMENT OF INDIA, ENHANCING TRANSPARENCY, EFFICIENCY, AND ACCESSIBILITY<br/><br/>SRILANKAN PARLIAMENTARY DELEGATION LED BY SRI LANKA’S MINISTER OF HEALTH AND MASS COMMUNICATION DR. NALINDA JAYATISSA CALLS ON LOK SABHA SPEAKER AT PARLIAMENT HOUSE</span>
</h3>
</div>
<div class="ReleaseDateSubHeaddateTime text-center pt20" id="PrDateTime">
                    Posted On:
                28 AUG 2025 7:22PM by PIB Delhi
                </div>
<div class="pt20">
</div>
<input id="hydphotoUrl" name="hydphotoUrl" type="hidden"/>
<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif"><span style="font-size:16px">Lok Sabha Speaker Shri Om Birla today met a 24-member high level delegation of the Sri Lanka–India Parliamentary Friendship Association at the Parliament House complex. The delegation was led by Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa, Minister of Health and Mass Communication of Sri Lanka and President of the Sri Lanka–India Parliamentary Friendship Association.</span></span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif"><span style="font-size:16px">Welcoming the delegation, Speaker Shri Om Birla said: “India and Sri Lanka share deep historical, cultural and civilisational ties. Today, these bonds have evolved into a strong, multi-dimensional partnership. Sri Lanka holds a special place in India’s ‘Neighbourhood First’ policy and ‘Vision SAGAR’.”</span></span></p>
<center><blockquote class="twitter-tweet"><p dir="ltr" lang="en">Pleased to meet the distinguished Parliamentary Delegation from Sri Lanka, visiting India for a special training programme organised by <a href="https://twitter.com/LokSabha_PRIDE?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">@LokSabha_PRIDE</a>. Such exchanges strengthen parliamentary diplomacy and deepen our democratic cooperation.<a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/IndiaSriLanka?src=hash&amp;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">#IndiaSriLanka</a> <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/ParliamentaryDiplomacy?src=hash&amp;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">#ParliamentaryDiplomacy</a> <a href="https://t.co/HZoDUJb2B1">pic.twitter.com/HZoDUJb2B1</a></p>— Om Birla (@ombirlakota) <a href="https://twitter.com/ombirlakota/status/1961037746375688205?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">August 28, 2025</a></blockquote> <script async="" charset="utf-8" src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js"></script></center>
<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif"><span style="font-size:16px">Referring to recent high-level exchanges, Shri Birla described Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi’s visit to Sri Lanka in April 2025 and Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake’s visit to India in December 2024 as milestones in bilateral relations.</span></span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif"><span style="font-size:16px">Speaker Birla welcomed the establishment of the India–Sri Lanka Parliamentary Friendship Association in the Sri Lankan Parliament, calling it a testament to the strength of bilateral ties. He emphasized the need for institutional cooperation and regular dialogue between the parliaments of both countries to share democratic practices and the experiences of elected representatives. Such exchanges, he said, will further reinforce democratic values.</span></span></p>
<center><blockquote class="twitter-tweet"><p dir="ltr" lang="en">Underlined the deep cultural and people to people ties between India and Sri Lanka. Welcomed formation of Sri Lanka–India Parliamentary Friendship Group in Sri Lankan parliament. Sri Lanka holds a special place in India’s ‘Neighbourhood First’ policy and ‘Vision SAGAR’ <a href="https://t.co/j6Ot2my40h">pic.twitter.com/j6Ot2my40h</a></p>— Om Birla (@ombirlakota) <a href="https://twitter.com/ombirlakota/status/1961037761668169930?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">August 28, 2025</a></blockquote> <script async="" charset="utf-8" src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js"></script></center>
<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif"><span style="font-size:16px">Shri Birla underlined that the shared heritage of India and Sri Lanka goes back thousands of years, with deep-rooted cultural and people-to-people connections forming key pillars of bilateral relations. He stressed that the development of the Ramayana and Buddhist tourism circuits, along with cultural exchanges and growing people-to-people contact, provide a strong foundation for these relations.</span></span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif"><span style="font-size:16px">He noted that the use of AI technology and digital innovations in the Indian Parliament has enhanced transparency, efficiency and ease of functioning, promoting paperless proceedings. Shri Birla also shared PRIDE’s role in conducting capacity-building programmes for legislators from over 110 countries and expressed India’s readiness to share these innovations with other nations.</span></span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif"><span style="font-size:16px">On his part, Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa thanked India for being the first responder during Sri Lanka’s economic crisis. He also praised India’s role in ensuring peace and stability in the Indian Ocean region, while describing India’s cooperation in health and education as a lifeline for Sri Lanka.</span></span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif"><span style="font-size:16px">At present, India–Sri Lanka cooperation is increasingly focused on investment-led development, grant assistance, trade, tourism, education, and cultural exchanges. Both nations have also signed several agreements in areas such as defence, energy, health, communications, and religious tourism.</span></span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif"><span style="font-size:16px">The Sri Lankan parliamentary delegation is on a visit to India from 26–30 August 2025. It comprises 20 Members of Parliament and 4 parliamentary staff.</span></span></p>
<p style="text-align:center"><span style="font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif"><span style="font-size:16px"><strong>***</strong></span></span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif"><span style="font-size:16px"><strong>AM</strong></span></span></p>

</div>
<div style="font-weight: 200; text-align: center; font-size: 30px;">
                            SRI LANKA IS A KEY PARTNER IN INDIA’S ‘NEIGHBOURHOOD FIRST’ POLICY AND ‘VISION SAGAR’: LOK SABHA SPEAKER SHRI OM BIRLA
                        </div>
<div style="height: 30px; width: 100%;">
</div>
<div style="font-weight: 200; text-align: center; font-size: 30px;">
<div style="height:30px;width:100%;"></div>BOTH INDIA AND SRI LANKA WELCOME THE FORMATION OF SRI LANKA-INDIA PARLIAMENTARY FRIENDSHIP ASSOCIATION AS A POSITIVE INITIATIVE<div style="height:30px;width:100%;"></div><div style="height:30px;width:100%;"></div>SRI LANKA APPRECIATES INDIA’S ROLE IN ENSURING PEACE AND STABILITY IN THE INDIAN OCEAN REGION AND EXPRESSES GRATITUDE FOR INDIA’S ASSISTANCE DURING ITS ECONOMIC CRISIS<div style="height:30px;width:100%;"></div><div style="height:30px;width:100%;"></div>LOK SABHA SPEAKER HIGHLIGHTS ADOPTION OF DIGITAL INNOVATIONS AND USE OF AI TECHNOLOGY IN PARLIAMENT OF INDIA, ENHANCING TRANSPARENCY, EFFICIENCY, AND ACCESSIBILITY<div style="height:30px;width:100%;"></div><div style="height:30px;width:100%;"></div>SRILANKAN PARLIAMENTARY DELEGATION LED BY SRI LANKA’S MINISTER OF HEALTH AND MASS COMMUNICATION DR. NALINDA JAYATISSA CALLS ON LOK SABHA SPEAKER AT PARLIAMENT HOUSE
                        </div>
<div style="height: 30px; width: 100%;">
</div>
<div style="text-align: center; font-size: 14px;">
                            Posted On:
                        28 AUG 2025 7:22PM by PIB Delhi
                        </div>
<div style="height: 30px; width: 100%;">
</div>
<div style="font-weight: 200; text-align: left; font-size: 16px;">
<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif"><span style="font-size:16px">Lok Sabha Speaker Shri Om Birla today met a 24-member high level delegation of the Sri Lanka–India Parliamentary Friendship Association at the Parliament House complex. The delegation was led by Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa, Minister of Health and Mass Communication of Sri Lanka and President of the Sri Lanka–India Parliamentary Friendship Association.</span></span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif"><span style="font-size:16px">Welcoming the delegation, Speaker Shri Om Birla said: “India and Sri Lanka share deep historical, cultural and civilisational ties. Today, these bonds have evolved into a strong, multi-dimensional partnership. Sri Lanka holds a special place in India’s ‘Neighbourhood First’ policy and ‘Vision SAGAR’.”</span></span></p>
<center><blockquote class="twitter-tweet"><p dir="ltr" lang="en">Pleased to meet the distinguished Parliamentary Delegation from Sri Lanka, visiting India for a special training programme organised by <a href="https://twitter.com/LokSabha_PRIDE?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">@LokSabha_PRIDE</a>. Such exchanges strengthen parliamentary diplomacy and deepen our democratic cooperation.<a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/IndiaSriLanka?src=hash&amp;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">#IndiaSriLanka</a> <a href="https://twitter.com/hashtag/ParliamentaryDiplomacy?src=hash&amp;ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">#ParliamentaryDiplomacy</a> <a href="https://t.co/HZoDUJb2B1">pic.twitter.com/HZoDUJb2B1</a></p>— Om Birla (@ombirlakota) <a href="https://twitter.com/ombirlakota/status/1961037746375688205?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">August 28, 2025</a></blockquote> <script async="" charset="utf-8" src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js"></script></center>
<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif"><span style="font-size:16px">Referring to recent high-level exchanges, Shri Birla described Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi’s visit to Sri Lanka in April 2025 and Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake’s visit to India in December 2024 as milestones in bilateral relations.</span></span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif"><span style="font-size:16px">Speaker Birla welcomed the establishment of the India–Sri Lanka Parliamentary Friendship Association in the Sri Lankan Parliament, calling it a testament to the strength of bilateral ties. He emphasized the need for institutional cooperation and regular dialogue between the parliaments of both countries to share democratic practices and the experiences of elected representatives. Such exchanges, he said, will further reinforce democratic values.</span></span></p>
<center><blockquote class="twitter-tweet"><p dir="ltr" lang="en">Underlined the deep cultural and people to people ties between India and Sri Lanka. Welcomed formation of Sri Lanka–India Parliamentary Friendship Group in Sri Lankan parliament. Sri Lanka holds a special place in India’s ‘Neighbourhood First’ policy and ‘Vision SAGAR’ <a href="https://t.co/j6Ot2my40h">pic.twitter.com/j6Ot2my40h</a></p>— Om Birla (@ombirlakota) <a href="https://twitter.com/ombirlakota/status/1961037761668169930?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">August 28, 2025</a></blockquote> <script async="" charset="utf-8" src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js"></script></center>
<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif"><span style="font-size:16px">Shri Birla underlined that the shared heritage of India and Sri Lanka goes back thousands of years, with deep-rooted cultural and people-to-people connections forming key pillars of bilateral relations. He stressed that the development of the Ramayana and Buddhist tourism circuits, along with cultural exchanges and growing people-to-people contact, provide a strong foundation for these relations.</span></span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif"><span style="font-size:16px">He noted that the use of AI technology and digital innovations in the Indian Parliament has enhanced transparency, efficiency and ease of functioning, promoting paperless proceedings. Shri Birla also shared PRIDE’s role in conducting capacity-building programmes for legislators from over 110 countries and expressed India’s readiness to share these innovations with other nations.</span></span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif"><span style="font-size:16px">On his part, Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa thanked India for being the first responder during Sri Lanka’s economic crisis. He also praised India’s role in ensuring peace and stability in the Indian Ocean region, while describing India’s cooperation in health and education as a lifeline for Sri Lanka.</span></span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif"><span style="font-size:16px">At present, India–Sri Lanka cooperation is increasingly focused on investment-led development, grant assistance, trade, tourism, education, and cultural exchanges. Both nations have also signed several agreements in areas such as defence, energy, health, communications, and religious tourism.</span></span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif"><span style="font-size:16px">The Sri Lankan parliamentary delegation is on a visit to India from 26–30 August 2025. It comprises 20 Members of Parliament and 4 parliamentary staff.</span></span></p>
<p style="text-align:center"><span style="font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif"><span style="font-size:16px"><strong>***</strong></span></span></p>
<p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-family:Times New Roman,Times,serif"><span style="font-size:16px"><strong>AM</strong></span></span></p>
</div>
